alert.note: Alert for Buffalo; Dawson; Gosper; Greeley; Hall; Hamilton; Howard; Merrick; Nance; Phelps; Polk; Sherman; Valley (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 02 at 3:30AM CST until January 03 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM THIS MORNING TO NOON CST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 7 inches and ice accumulations of one tenth to four tenths of an inch. Northwest winds gusting as high as 35 mph tonight through Tuesday. * WHERE...Portions of central Nebraska. * WHEN...From 6 AM this morning to noon CST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Power outages and tree damage are likely due to the ice. Travel could be nearly impossible. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Isolated slick spots are possible for the morning commute today, but the hazardous conditions are more likely to impact the evening commute and the morning commute on Tuesday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A mixture of freezing rain and rain will develop this morning. Temperatures may rise enough during the afternoon that portions of area sees melting and little ice accumulation during the afternoon hours. Then freezing rain is expected to transition to snow during the evening and overnight as temperatures fall. The highest snow accumulation is expected northwest of a line from Lexington to Greeley.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
